intro: Humboltia vittata, commonly known as the white sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its small, white to pale blue flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas and desert scrub habitats. Humboltia vittata has lance-shaped leaves that are usually hairy and arranged oppositely along the stems. It is a perennial herb that produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds.
